references.paper_title: Sample-efficient learning of stackelberg equilibria in general-sum games
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on learning Stackelberg equilibria, a concept central to the tax design problem in congestion games.

references.paper_title: Studies in the economics of transportation
references.reason: This is a foundational paper in the field of congestion games, introducing many of the core concepts and providing a mathematical framework for analysis.

references.paper_title: Taxes for linear atomic congestion games
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the problem of tax design in atomic congestion games, providing insights into optimal mechanisms for achieving social welfare.

references.paper_title: Learning in congestion games with bandit feedback
references.reason: This paper is relevant due to its focus on learning in congestion games under limited feedback, a direct parallel to the learning problem addressed in the current paper.
